Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit a solo homer in the ninth inning to at least put a little heat in the game
Bobby Witt Jr. dove to snare a ground-ball rocket toward short and started a pretty double play
Pre-Game Insights: Jazz Chisholm Jr. expressed confidence in the team's ability to win the series, saying 'Still feels the same, that we're going to win it'
Aaron Judge quipped, 'If I'm not hitting 1.000, I'm not feeling good'
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge acknowledged that the team had hard-hit balls that went for outs, but said 'We get that one to get in the seats, man, it's a different ballgame'
Aaron Boone said 'hitting is hard. You're not going to hold him down long' when asked about Judge's struggles
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees had 16 hits and 13 walks in the two games, but scored only eight runs
The team's starting pitchers, Gerrit Cole and Carlos Rod√≥n, have combined for a 7.27 ERA in the first two games
Others: The Yankees are built to win with offense, having averaged more than five runs per game during the season
Seth Lugo, one of the best pitchers in the AL this season, will pitch for the Royals in Game 3
